awd_titl_txt: QLCI-CG: The Open Quantum Frontier Institute
awd_abstract_narration:
The Quantum Leap Challenge Institutes (QLCI) program is part of the Quantum Leap, one of the research Big Ideas promoted by the National Science Foundation. This award is a QLCI Conceptualization Grant, which supports activities to build capacity among teams planning for the large-scale, interdisciplinary Challenge Institute projects that aim to advance the frontiers of quantum information science and engineering. Research at these Institutes will span the focus areas of quantum computation, quantum communication, quantum simulation, and/or quantum sensing. The Institutes are expected to foster multidisciplinary approaches to specific scientific, technological, and workforce development goals in these fields.
 
This Conceptualization Grant will develop well-formulated plans for a future Challenge Institute proposal along the themes of open quantum systems, new materials for quantum computing, quantum sensing, quantum simulation, quantum optics, and quantum education research.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: TRUSTEES OF THE COLORADO SCHOOL OF MINES

por.por_cntn:
This Quantum Leap Challenge Institute conceptualization grant project enabled a series of workshops and course development initiatives in the area of quantum information science and technology (QIST). The primary project outcomes were two workshops which brought together QIST researchers from academia, industry, and national labs to chart a new path forward for training a quantum workforce in the United States. The ?Open Quantum Frontier Institute? workshop was hosted in February 2020 in Golden, Colorado and included 91 registered attendees, representing 11 different colleges, universities, national laboratories and corporations. The Open Quantum Frontier Institute Virtual Workshop on Quantum Education was hosted in May 2020 by San Jose State University and included 60 registered participants, representing 9 different institutions (academic and corporate) in the US and the UK.

Through these workshops, new research and educational collaborations were made which resulted in the development of new QIST courses and lab modules at several participating institutions. The participating institutions worked together to submit a larger proposal for a Quantum Leap Challenge Institute in Fall 2020. The broader impacts of this project included student involvement in the research and educational workshops where students were able to present posters of their research and learn about new developments in QIST both in industry and academic research labs. The award also facilitated increased QIST educational capabilities at the Colorado School of Mines and San Jose State University through new laboratory equipment and course development.

 

 


Last Modified: 04/15/2022
Modified by: Hilary M Hurst
